skill.name: enact/hello-simple
skill.description: A bare-bones example that prints a greeting
skill.summary: Simple Enact tool that prints Hello from Enact!
skill.author: EnactProtocol

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The .sigstore-bundle.json references are Sigstore code-signing artifacts, not skill code. High entropy strings are expected certificate data. The skill is a simple echo command that outputs a greeting.

high_findings.title: C2 Keywords in Sigstore Bundle
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged 'C2 keywords' in .sigstore-bundle.json at lines 5, 50, 56. This is a FALSE POSITIVE. The file is not part of the skill's operational code - it is a Sigstore code-signing artifact containing cryptographic certificates.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Sigstore bundles contain cryptographic certificate data which triggers keyword scanners. The file is not in the skill's file_structure - only SKILL.md exists in this skill.

high_findings.title: High Entropy Strings in Certificate
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged high entropy strings as potential obfuscated payloads. This is a FALSE POSITIVE. High entropy is expected in base64-encoded X.509 certificates used for code signing.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Cryptographic certificates are designed to have high entropy. This is a security feature, not obfuscation.

high_findings.title: Long Line Flagged as Obfuscated
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged a 2463-character line as likely obfuscated. This is a FALSE POSITIVE. The line is a base64-encoded Sigstore certificate, not malicious code.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Sigstore certificates are base64-encoded and naturally long. This is standard certificate format, not obfuscation.

high_findings.title: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm False Match
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged 'weak cryptographic algorithm' at SKILL.md:4. This is a FALSE POSITIVE. Line 4 contains only YAML frontmatter describing the skill description, not crypto code.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: SKILL.md line 4 contains 'description: A bare-bones example that prints a greeting' - no cryptographic algorithms present.

content.value_statement: This simple Enact tool demonstrates basic tool usage by printing a greeting message. It serves as a starting point for learning the Enact protocol.
actual_capabilities: Prints a greeting message to the console
Shows how to define a simple command-based tool
Serves as a template for creating new Enact tools
limitations: Only prints a static greeting message
Cannot accept user input or arguments

use_cases.title: Learn the Enact protocol
use_cases.description: New developers can study this skill to understand how Enact tools are structured and defined.

use_cases.title: Quick template starter
use_cases.description: Use this as a starting template when building new Enact tools with minimal boilerplate.

use_cases.title: Test tool integration
use_cases.description: Verify that the Enact tool system is working correctly by running a simple command.

prompt_templates.title: Basic usage
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the enact/hello-simple tool to see a greeting message.

prompt_templates.title: Learning inquiry
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how the hello-simple Enact tool works and explain its structure.

prompt_templates.title: Template request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Enact tool similar to hello-simple but with a custom message.

prompt_templates.title: Integration check
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify the Enact tool system is working by running the hello-simple example.

best_practices: Start with this simple example when learning Enact tool development
Keep tool commands focused on single, clear operations
Use descriptive names and documentation for discoverability
anti_patterns: Avoid modifying this tool to do complex tasks - it is designed as a simple example
Do not assume this tool can accept dynamic input or arguments
Avoid using this as a template for production tools without adding error handling

faq.question: What does this tool do?
faq.answer: It prints the message 'Hello from Enact!' using the echo command.

faq.question: Can I customize the greeting?
faq.answer: This version is fixed. You can fork it and modify the command to print any message you need.

faq.question: Is this tool safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes. This tool only runs a simple echo command with a hardcoded message and has no file system or network access.

faq.question: What is the Enact protocol?
faq.answer: Enact is a protocol for defining tools that AI agents can use. This skill is a minimal example of an Enact tool.

faq.question: How do I create my own tool like this?
faq.answer: Study this example's SKILL.md file. Define a name, version, description, and command in the YAML frontmatter.

faq.question: What tools can use this skill?
faq.answer: This skill supports Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through the Enact protocol integration.
